Description: Fragment of a tapestry band applied and sewn to plain weave, undyed linen textile; includes a run and fell seam; this was probably part of the decoration of a tunic (clavus); all the weft threads of the tapestry are now missing - they would have been wool, only the linen remains; the band has been sewn with blue linen threads (S sun Z ply) on each side with oversewing, and in the middle with running stitches; the decoration is no longer clear but some human face details and vegetal motifs in undyed linen are still visible; balanced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/14), weft-undyed linen (S/14); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/12), weft- undyed linen (S/72), wool missing; edges all ragged and cut
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
